block.p: Mary Louise Napier was married in New York yesterday to Daniel Paul Zuzunaga. The Rev. Joseph A. Hart, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University.
Mrs. Zuzunaga, 38, was until August 2006 the deputy chief of staff at the Guggenheim Foundation, the organization that oversees the museums. She graduated from Gettysburg College.
Mary Louise Napier was married in New York yesterday to Daniel Paul Zuzunaga. The Rev. Joseph A. Hart, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paulâ€™s Chapel at Columbia University.
Mary Louise Napier was married in New York yesterday to Daniel Paul Zuzunaga. The Rev. Joseph A. Hart, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University.
Mrs. Zuzunaga, 38, was until August 2006 the deputy chief of staff at the Guggenheim Foundation, the organization that oversees the museums. She graduated from Gettysburg College.

She is the daughter of Jane F. Napier of Jupiter, Fla., and the late William J. Napier. Her father was a founder of Manning & Napier, an investment advisory business in Rochester. Her mother is a trustee of Hobart and William Smith Colleges in Geneva, N.Y.

Mr. Zuzunaga, 36, is a senior design strategist at the Arnell Group, an advertising and marketing concern in New York. He graduated from the University of Wisconsin and has a master's degree in architecture from Columbia.

He is a son of Betty J. Petersen and Luis E. Zuzunaga, both of Lodi, Wis., and a stepson of Carol Zuzunaga and of Lars Petersen. The bridegroom's mother, a registered nurse, teaches at the University of Wisconsin School of Nursing in Madison under a contract with her employer, Home Health United, a nonprofit agency. His father retired as a Spanish teacher at Lodi High School.
